episodeTitle: Coming to an End! The Final Decisive Battle Against Hordy!
episodeTitleJapanese: ついに決着！ホーディ最終決戦
episodeTitleRomanized: Tsui ni Ketchaku! Hōdi Saishū Kessen
description: The Straw Hat Pirates face off against the New Fish-Man Pirates officers in their final battles. Luffy defeats Hody Jones with Elephant Gun and Elephant Gatling, while the rest of the crew defeats their respective opponents, showcasing the results of their two-year training.

events.title: Brook Defeats Zeo
events.description: Brook uses his ice-based abilities to finish off Zeo, the Japanese wobbegong fish-man who could camouflage himself. The victory demonstrates Brook's growth during the time skip.
events.significance: Shows Brook's mastery of ice abilities gained during the two-year training period.

events.title: Usopp Defeats Daruma
events.description: Usopp uses his new Pop Green techniques, including Green Star: Human Drake and Green Star: Impact Wolf, to defeat Daruma, the cookiecutter shark fish-man known for his burrowing abilities.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's botanical combat abilities developed on the Boin Archipelago during the time skip.

events.title: Chopper's Controlled Monster Point Reveal
events.description: Chopper reveals he can now control his Monster Point transformation using only one Rumble Ball, maintaining the form for three minutes. He demonstrates this by defeating Dosun, shattering the hammerhead shark fish-man's iron hammer.
events.significance: Major power upgrade for Chopper, showing he has mastered his most powerful form which was previously uncontrollable and required three Rumble Balls.

quotes.text: By eating a single Rumble Ball, I can fight in this form for three minutes.
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Explaining his new Monster Point control to Usopp

events.title: Chopper Defeats Dosun
events.description: Using his controlled Monster Point form, Chopper attacks Dosun with his claws, shattering Dosun's massive hammer and critically injuring the hammerhead shark fish-man.
events.significance: Proves Chopper's Monster Point is now a reliable combat form rather than a last resort.

events.title: Franky Defeats Ikaros Much
events.description: Franky exits his General Franky robot and uses his new ultimate weapon, the Franky Radical Beam, a powerful laser attack that defeats the giant squid fish-man Ikaros Much.
events.significance: Showcases Franky's cybernetic upgrades from Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory during the time skip.

events.title: Jinbe and Sanji Defeat Wadatsumi
events.description: Jinbe hits Wadatsumi with Vagabond Drill, causing the giant fish-man to release his air. Sanji follows up with Hell Memories, a powerful fire kick that completely chars Wadatsumi and sends him crashing down onto his comrades.
events.significance: Demonstrates the coordination between Jinbe and Sanji, and showcases Sanji's powerful fire techniques developed during the time skip.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Hyouzou
events.description: Zoro continues to dominate Hyouzou, the best swordsman on Fish-Man Island and master of the Eight Sword Style. Zoro dismisses him as a mere frog in a well, demonstrating the vast gap in their abilities.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's overwhelming superiority after his training with Mihawk, defeating Fish-Man Island's greatest swordsman with ease.

quotes.text: You're just a frog in a well.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro dismissing Hyouzou as an opponent

events.title: Hody Bites Luffy Repeatedly
events.description: Hody Jones, empowered by Energy Steroids, grabs Luffy's arms and bites him repeatedly in the same spot, exploiting an earlier wound. Despite tanking Luffy's attacks, Hody shows his savage fighting style.
events.significance: Demonstrates the temporary power boost from Energy Steroids and Hody's brutal, animalistic combat approach.

events.title: Luffy Uses Red Hawk on Hody
events.description: Luffy counters Hody's attack with Red Hawk, a powerful fire-enhanced punch that combines his rubber abilities with Haki and ignition. He forces Hody to release him, though the Energy Steroid-enhanced Hody withstands more damage than expected.
events.significance: Showcases one of Luffy's new signature techniques that combines his Gear Second speed with fire and Haki.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Hody with Elephant Gun
events.description: Luffy uses Elephant Gun, a Gear Third technique enhanced with Busoshoku Haki, delivering a devastating punch that sends Hody Jones crashing into the Noah ship. The attack demonstrates Luffy's mastery of combining Devil Fruit powers with Haki.
events.significance: The decisive blow that defeats the main antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc, proving Luffy's growth after the two-year time skip.

events.title: Luffy Uses Elephant Gatling on Noah
events.description: After defeating Hody, Luffy attempts to destroy the massive Noah ship to prevent it from destroying Fish-Man Island. He uses Elephant Gatling, a rapid-fire barrage of Gear Third punches, to smash the ship apart.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's incredible destructive power and his willingness to destroy the ancient ship to save the island, though this conflicts with the promise to Joy Boy.

events.title: Hody Jones Finally Defeated
events.description: Hody Jones is blasted out unconscious from the Noah after Luffy's Elephant Gatling attack, marking the end of the main conflict of the Fish-Man Island Arc. Despite the Energy Steroids, Hody proves no match for post-time skip Luffy.
events.significance: Concludes the battle against the New Fish-Man Pirates and their plan to destroy the Ryugu Kingdom. However, it also shows the beginning of the Energy Steroid side effects that will age Hody prematurely.

quotes.text: By eating a single Rumble Ball, I can fight in this form for three minutes.
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Explaining his new Monster Point control

quotes.text: You're just a frog in a well.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro

themes.description: The episode showcases the results of the Straw Hat Pirates' two-year training period, with each member displaying new abilities and techniques that completely outclass their opponents.
themes.symbolism: The one-sided nature of the battles symbolizes the crew's transformation from rookies to experienced pirates ready for the New World.

themes.description: Hody's reliance on Energy Steroids represents the dangers of seeking power through artificial means rather than genuine training and growth.
themes.symbolism: The Energy Steroids serve as a metaphor for performance-enhancing drugs and their devastating long-term consequences.

themes.description: The Straw Hats work together to defeat all the New Fish-Man Pirates officers simultaneously, showing their improved coordination as a crew.
themes.symbolism: The simultaneous victories demonstrate that the entire crew has grown stronger together, not just Luffy.

characterSpotlights.role: Main protagonist finishing the arc's main battle
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his new Haki-enhanced techniques and overwhelming power, showing he is ready for the New World's challenges.
keyActions: Uses Red Hawk to counter Hody's attacks
Attempts to destroy Noah with Elephant Gatling

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting crew member with major power reveal
characterSpotlights.development: Chopper reveals his mastered Monster Point, showing significant growth in controlling his Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Reveals controlled Monster Point requiring only one Rumble Ball
Defeats Dosun by shattering his hammer
Maintains control for the full three-minute duration
quotes: By eating a single Rumble Ball, I can fight in this form for three minutes.

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting crew member demonstrating overwhelming superiority
characterSpotlights.development: Zoro shows that his training with Mihawk has elevated him to a level where even the best swordsman on Fish-Man Island is beneath him.
keyActions: Dismisses Hyouzou as 'a frog in a well'
quotes: You're just a frog in a well.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battles to show more of the Straw Hats struggling, making the fights appear more balanced than in the manga where victories were more decisive.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapters 645-646 of the manga, maintaining a relatively close 2:1 chapter-to-episode ratio.
The Fish-Man Island Arc is often criticized for its pacing in the anime, with fans noting that the Straw Hats' overwhelming superiority reduced dramatic tension.

sources.title: One Piece: Why Is The Fish-Man Island Arc So Hated

trivia.fact: Episode 566 achieved an 8.8% TV rating in Japan, ranking 4th for its timeslot.
Chopper's controlled Monster Point was first revealed in this episode, marking a major development from Episode 290 where he first used the uncontrolled version.
